SwissCheese.engine.display

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • SwissCheese.engine.display.Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Window
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A window class. This is a JFrame window which renders the game while the game is running. This JFrame is only used for the main game loop, and not for any other prompts or menus.
    Since:
    2018-12-11, v0.2
    Version:
    v0.3
    Author:
    Alex Kalinins
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window(int width,
              int height,
              boolean fitToScreen,
              Map map,
              float FOV,
              SaveMetadata metadataa,
              TexturePack texturePack,
              View... view)
        Constructor for the window of SwissCheese.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the Window.
        height - the height of the Window
        fitToScreen - true if Window will fit the monitor size. If true, width and height will be disregarded, and the monitor width and height will be used in their place.
        map - the Map of the game in which the player is placed.
        FOV - the field of view of the player - how much they are seeing. This float must be between -0.1 and -2.5. If it is less than -2.5 the game is un-playable. If it is 0 or more, raycasting calculations will not work.
        metadataa - the SaveMetadata of the game. Needed for saving the game so that they can be identified in the future based on their name, and the time of saving. (Variable name misspelled intentionally).
        texturePack - the TexturePack object from which texture resources will be opened in order to have walls with textures.
        view - the view from the camera. This variable is only needed if opening a game save! If no variable is passed through, a new View is created.

    • Method Detail

      • switchBuffer

        public void switchBuffer()
        switchBuffer() switches the buffers of the BufferStrategy. This allows the next frame to be rendered inside a buffer of the buffer strategy, and then it switches.
